testdat 0.0.0.9014

  • Reference
  • Changelog

Create an expectation from a check function

expect_make.Rd

expect_make() creates an expection from a vectorised checking function to allow simple generation of domain specific data checks.

expect_make(func, func_desc = NULL, vars = FALSE, all = TRUE,
  env = caller_env())

Arguments

func

A function whose first argument takes a vector to check, and returns a logical vector of the same length with the results.
func_desc

A character function description to use in the expectation failure message.
vars

Should the generated function take a single variable name or a vars() object?
all

Function to use to combine results for each vector.
env

The parent environment of the function, defaults to the calling environment of expect_make()

Value

An expect_*() style function.

Examples

expect_make(chk_pattern)
#> function (var, pattern, flt = TRUE, data = get_testdata()) 
#> {
#>     expect_allany(vars(!!ensym(var)), chk_pattern, !!enquo(flt), 
#>         !!enquo(data), args = list(pattern = pattern), allany = chk_filter_all, 
#>         func_desc = NULL)
#> }
#> <environment: 0x55c44df923c0>
expect_make(chk_values)
#> function (var, ..., miss = getOption("testdat.miss"), flt = TRUE, 
#>     data = get_testdata()) 
#> {
#>     expect_allany(vars(!!ensym(var)), chk_values, !!enquo(flt), 
#>         !!enquo(data), args = list(... = ..., miss = miss), allany = chk_filter_all, 
#>         func_desc = NULL)
#> }
#> <environment: 0x55c44df923c0>
